questions.question_text: A technician is creating a network topology diagram. Which of the following would be the MOST appropriate to include? (Choose two.)

choices.B: A list of the ports on each device and what they are connected to
choices.A: A list of network addresses for each device
choices.F: The MAC address and serial number of each device on the network
choices.D: Settings, configuration details, and notes on proper operations
choices.C: Technical specifications and performance ratings for the devices
choices.E: A list of devices that need replacement within the next 6-12 months

discussion.content:
B and C are correct answer!
Network Topology Diagrams
A network topology diagram provides a map for how everything connects in
an organization’s network. These diagrams include switches, routers, WAPs,
servers, and workstations (see Figure 28-1). More complex diagrams describe
connection types and speeds, and the technologies in use (listing a WAP as
an 802.11ac AC2600, for example). Many organizations rely on the Cisco
icon set as a universal visual aid for creating these diagrams (see Figure 28-
2).

comments.content: I googled the network topology diagram, and the images show that the devices' ip addresses and ports. So, I choose A and B.

discussion.content:
Can someone confirm that? As per Mike Meyers' book:

"A network topology diagram provides a map for how everything connects in
an organization’s network. These diagrams include switches, routers, WAPs,
servers, and workstations (see Figure 28-1). More complex diagrams describe
connection types and speeds, and the technologies in use (listing a WAP as
an 802.11ac AC2600, for example)"

So I guess that "C" could fit here?

A. CD-Re-Writeable ? No lol why not CD-ROM

B. Blu-ray-Writeable ? uhm no same as above again why not just BluRay-Disc 

C. Thin client- again assuming the device that requires re-imagine is some sort of kiosk self checkout- then it's thin client device. So are now going to reimage a thin client with another thin client? uhmm highly unlikely.

D. Network boot-->wake-on--->PXE boot ? Highly Likely the correct answer. Image installed on server side and image deployed via Windows Deployment Services role on windows server.
CDRW is WRONG. This is a remotely managed W10 machine. The easiest way to restore the system OS is via a network boot.

comments.content: NO correct answer becuse the key word here store
A manager will have network access and can be directed by a technician over the phone dumbass

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The option with the least administrative effort would be D. The top comment is correct, you could use A. but that would require being on the phone with the user walking them through what to do or having to send a tech out. B is the same reason as A. C I agree that likely its already a thin client and is unlikely to be the answer.
D is likely the answer because all you should have to do is ask the user to restart the machine. For those that say that A is the correct user because its a store, are you implying that the store doesn't have network capabilities? I have worked IT for a grocery store chain, they have a network.

Selected Answer: D
The image contains literally everything you need to get it up and running again. Least admin effort would just tell the staff to restart the PC and press the button combo to start network boot and reimage it...done
B? CD RW doesn't have enough space for win 10, all others require a lot of administrative effort, not to mention question states that store employees were instructed to do this.
The least administrative effort is the keyword here. Network and thinn client requires the most administrative effort. So CDRW is the most suitable answer

comments.content: As well they mention the drivers/apps are managed via the network, not the OS (implying the OS is hosted locally). If it's just the drivers for the hardware locally that's not working, then a CDRW would work (also implying the computer has a disk drive). These are all variables that aren't stated or known.

discussion.content: A CD-RW could never be it simply has not enough space to contain either the win 10 iso or any third party image tool.
Correct answer is C

comments.content: That may be there to throw us off. The question doesn't say the OS needs to be reloaded remotely just says it's managed remotely. I would stick with A but the question is garbo.

discussion.content: ''A remotely managed self-checkout machine '' That's the key guys so either C or D will work.
it is D
The image contains drivers for locally attached third-party hardware not for windows 10 , CD-RW has space for those image

D is correct.
A B - just no.
C - makes no sense
how in the world would a 700MB CD-RW reload windows 10 when windows 10 installation media is 15+GBs in size?

questions.question_text: A remotely managed self-checkout machine in a retail store runs Windows 10. The image contains drivers for locally attached third-party hardware (i.e., receipt printers), third-party applications, and proprietary applications made by the company's IT department. The self-checkout machine is experiencing errors, and the store employees are instructed to reload the OS. Which of the following would be the BEST option to restore full functionality to this machine with the least administrative effort?

A Chief Executive Officer (CEO) is giving a presentation at an industry conference but forgot to bring a laptop. The company has emailed several large presentation files and the links to several videos that will be streamed during the presentation. While showing the last video, it starts to buffer, times out, and will not display. The CEO restarts the phone that is being used for the presentation and verifies there is enough free storage space, but the video still will not play.
Which of the following is MOST likely causing the issue?

discussion.content: The CEO is an idiot

comments.content: now THAT is the correct answer

discussion.content: CEO must have been Ann or Joe
Now former CEO...

questions.question_text: A desktop technician is responsible for the OS migration of 300 end users. As part of the migration, the technician must save the end users' data to a temporary shared drive. The data must include any hidden files to ensure 100% of the data is retained. Which of the following commands will achieve this result by default?

discussion.content: robocopy = Robust File Copy

questions.question_text: A technician needs to connect to a server using a secure terminal application. The technician must be able to reboot the server quickly and restart all the daemons with this application. Which of the following methods will the technician MOST likely use? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
I would say it's rather SSH and putty.
A server with daemons is a unixoid OS (probably Linux) and it will not accept (Microsofts) RDP.
But you actually don't need Putty on most OS's even WIN10 can establish SSH over CMD.
All other answers don't make any sense. (IMHO)

comments.content: Agreed that it is SSH and putty but for different reasons. Putty is a terminal emulator application (as referenced in the question) and SSH client. SSH is the secure part of the question and is commonly used for terminal input whereas RDP provides a graphical interface rather than terminal (also I don't think Putty natively supports RDP).

discussion.content: "A technician needs to connect to a server using a secure terminal application." - SSH would be for that. "The technician must be able to reboot the server quickly and restart all the daemons with this application." - RDP will allow you to remotely control the server so that you can reboot it. That's my guess...

comments.content: This is correct. CompTIA A+ doesn't reference putty, however gives multiple references and learning material towards RDP. Even though the above comments are correct in the real world where you would use putty, with CompTIA they don't go "in-depth" with their explanations or answers, therefore, requiring the reader not to think too much into it (very frustrating).
We need to be flexible on this, if PUTTY is not in the choices when taking the exam then RDP is the closest one

discussion.content: Putty is not one of Comptia a+ 1002 objectives, so that is not the correct answer. RDP is. Answers shown are correct.
SSH and putty.
